storyInfo: Ann-Maier is having trouble finding a job in Siesta. She starts her first one as she comes to terms with the home she never knew.

attributes.content: This is the breeze from Old Siesta...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: This is where the sea fowlbeasts come to make their home, isn't it?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Grandpa... I found it... after all this time, I've finally...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: (Takes a deep breath)
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Siesta—I'm back—!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Let's leave all the bad in the past! No more troubles!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: It's all good days ahead from here on!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Wh-What?!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: That's my resume! Why is it in the trash?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Didn't you say you tried everything, but there just wasn't a suitable opportunity for me?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: But nobody even opened my portfolio before it went into the trash with my resume!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Please, calm down, Ann-Maier.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: I said I would try, as the Siesta HR Office does for every job applicant.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: But I can't help it that no one is interested in working with you.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: Why doesn't anyone want to hire me?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: You can say it straight. No need to worry about my feelings. It's the only way I'll improve.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Just tell me what I need to work on. I won't disappoint you!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Alright... I'll tell you, but it's not an easy thing to change.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: The issue is—
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: You're too unlucky.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: You see this mountain of documents? That's the resumes I received today, alone! How am I supposed to read through all that?
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: And so, what I do is—
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: The clerk takes a stack out of the pile and throws them into the trash. The pile of papers gets a little thinner.
Y-You didn't even glance them!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I only have so much energy.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: But reading resumes is your job!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: No, my job is to pick the right talents for prospective employers.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: And our most important standard, right now, is whether the applicant can bring good luck to those employers.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: Siesta has had enough misfortune these past few years. The last thing that employers want is another accident.
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: And you just had the bad luck of having your resume thrown in the trash... why would an employer want to hire someone as jinxed as you?
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: J-Jinxed? This is ridiculous...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I came here full of hope and expectation...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I would have been happy to end up on a tiny engineering team, even an assistant post on an intern's wages.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: But you're saying no one wants to hire me because I'm too unlucky?!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Hey, what are you doing? Calm down—
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: Just you wait! I'll find my own way! I'll show you... I'll find my own projects, form my own team!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Who needs your... your...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Hey! Wait...
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: Ann-Maier, calm down, don't—
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: My trash can! You need to pay for that!
attributes.name: Office Clerk

attributes.content: I'm not paying for one stinking fowlbeast egg!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Deep breaths... deep breaths...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Just a lazy city hall clerk. That doesn't prove anything.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: If Siesta's official channels won't work, I can look for private construction firms.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: And if that doesn't work either, I can go knock on some doors up and down the streets.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: There are construction projects everywhere in Siesta. There's got to be a place that'll take me... right?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Is Siesta really like grandpa said?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Try some local Siestan snacks and turn that frown upside-down!
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: My pies are a regular on 'Siesta's Best Eats'!
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Best Eats?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Here! First-time customers get one free!
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Oh, thanks!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: (Bites)
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Er...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Her brow furrows slightly.
Wh-What is it? Is it not to your taste?
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Oh, no, it's great.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I just didn't expect it to be so... sweet.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I've never had sour orange pies this sweet.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: This isn't a sour orange pie. It's a sweet orange pie.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Sweet orange pie?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Just a sour orange pie with more sweet fillings, really.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: But it's the sour kind that's Siesta's specialty, isn't it? That's what grandpa always used to make.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: He only used oranges that were completely green, without a single hint of yellow.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: And certainly no sweet fillings either...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Ooh, now that's the classic, old-timey recipe for the real die-hards.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Was your grandpa Siestan?
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I'm Siestan too.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I guess you haven't been back in a while.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: My family moved to Columbia when I was little.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: No wonder why you sound so Columbian.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Hank! One sweet orange pie, please!
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: Back again, Lut?
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Shh, don't tell Harley!
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: (Whisper) The sweetest kind, please!
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: Alright, here you go.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Thanks, Hank!
attributes.name: Young Boy

attributes.content: The boy grabs the bag and runs away.
So much honey...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Not just that. That one had a triple serving of condensed milk, and caramel on the bottom.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: No wonder it's so sweet. That's not a sour orange pie anymore, is it?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: What am I supposed to do about it?
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: The kids like it sweet, and so do the tourists. Sour orange pies have to change too, if I want to sell them.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: It's not your granddaddy's Siesta anymore...
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: I guess you're right.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: This place is very different from the Siesta that Grandpa used to talk about.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Some things stay the same.
Siestans have accepted new tastes, but sometimes we long for the tastes of the past too.
Hey, if it isn't the up-and-coming star of city hall.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Didn't think you'd have time for my humble little stall.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Just passing by... I'll have one sour orange pie, please, Hank.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Spare me the formalities. It didn't use to be a thing back in our Old Siesta days.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: (This man is from city hall too...)
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I'm glad we can still get along like the old days, now that all the old shops on Fashion Street are completely unrecognizable.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Well, the rebuilding has gone alright.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: We got compensated for business interruption, and we've heard about the coming subsidies. We're not complaining.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: People with too much time on their hands, like me, can set up a stall to have something to do.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Here, your sour orange pie, sour enough to make your teeth fall off. I know the tastes of Fashion Street.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: ...I appreciate everyone's cooperation.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Thanks, Hank.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Excuse me.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Oh? You're still here?
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Is construction still going on at the Fashion Street that you were talking about?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Around the clock.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Word on the street is that a couple of foreign moguls are waiting for construction to finish before building Terra's biggest water park in the area.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: You're exaggerating, Hank...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: It's just to help the people of the old district get used to life on the nomadic city.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Siesta can't wallow in the memories of old forever, after all.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: (Siesta's past can still be seen in that Fashion Street.)
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: (But even this little fragment of memory will...)
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Is Fashion Street still hiring workers?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Easy, easy... careful, kids, this stuff is precious!
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: I told you we can't send all of this to that new warehouse... they're not... I'm not ready.
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: They shouldn't be hidden away like this. Don't you agree, my love?
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: It's all good, honey.
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: They won't be useful until our 'Lava Fissure' musical BBQ is open for business, will they?
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: These were passed down to me from my mother, who inherited it from her own mother.
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: I polish them regularly. You can hear them ring when you knock on them!
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: I just can't...
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Don't worry! We've got all your guitars, drums, and those... are they xylophones or harps? Anyway, we've got them all wrapped up.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Shock-absorbing pads all around, and watertight wrappings that won't let the slightest bit of moisture in.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: They'll be perfectly in tune when your, er, musical BBQ opens. You can count on us!
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: I'm not talking about the instruments!
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: I'm talking about the barbecue racks! Did you wrap them up properly too?
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Huh...? Those weren't for scrap?
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Wh-What did you just say?!
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: So this is Fashion Street...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Looks like there was a bit of misunderstanding with that shop?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: The argument seems to be getting heated. Should we intervene?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Don't worry, it's not an argument. The residents just need time to say goodbye to the 'good ol' days'.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: After all, most shops on this street are older than you and me put together.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I've heard stories about that street, on the shores of Siesta.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Barbecue racks on the beach underneath colorful beach umbrellas, music loud enough to drown out the waves, all the residents gathered for the party.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Grandpa said Siesta wasn't so built-up back then. There were few beautiful high-risers, and equally few tourists...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: But the people were no less happy back then.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Your grandfather and mine would have a lot to talk about, if they ever met.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Your grandfather?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: He was an eccentric optimist.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Most old people are. A little weird, but always optimistic... even though they had their share of problems to deal with when they were young.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Compared to that, I'm...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: She gazes at the center of the city—
Beautiful high-risers line the skyline in the distance, while cars drive through clean and broad streets.
Many tourists come and go, a few trendily-dressed figures taking pictures of volcano graffiti at a corner.
It is the Siesta that her grandfather had dreamt about.
But to her, everything seems so distant, as though she was only halfway here.
For a moment, she felt like there was a whole sour orange stuck in her throat.
Speaking of which—
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: My colleagues were talking about a 'the trash can crusher' in the city hall group chat.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I heard about the young girl's windy path to Siesta.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: She must be quite the optimist, to keep going despite all the trials and tribulations. Admirable.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Now that I think about it, her name was also Ann-Maier. What a coincidence, huh?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I got carried away... I'm planning to apologize to that clerk later.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I'm sorry! I'll pay for whatever damage I caused.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I'm not here to collect damages.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I just happened to pass by the sour orange pie stall, and I just happened to be in a position to pick up a mess left by an irresponsible coworker—
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Helping a young woman who came to Siesta looking for a job.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: After all, I know how it feels to have plenty of talent, but no place to use it.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Thank you, Mr. Costa...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: But what do I do?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: What do you want to do?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: What... do I want to do?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I wanted to ask if there were any shops on Fashion Street that needed a hand in their rebuilding...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: But what happened at the instrument shop as I passed by made me worry whether I could do a good job.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Because I know nothing about New Siesta, and what I know about Old Siesta is limited to the stories my grandpa told me.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: From the Obsidian Festival, to the advent of the nomadic city, to the farewell party for Mount Siesta that I've heard so many people talk about in my time here...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I missed so much... I don't know what Siesta needs today.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: You don't.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: So what?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I doubt your grandfather knew much about the tiny coastal town when he visited for the first time.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Are you not in the same boat as he was?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: You have plenty of time to learn more about this city.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I'm not sure I can... I've wasted so much time.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Stop thinking. Let's go.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Where to?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: To do what you came to do in the first place.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: The sound of construction on Fashion Street begins to fade as night falls, replaced by the excited atmosphere of the inhabitants gathering and enjoying themselves.
Except—
This is...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Even the sign outside is gone from this shop. This scent...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Coffee?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Yes, this used to be a cafe.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: This will be your workplace for a while.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Work here? Am I supposed to rebuild the shop?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: But where's the owner? Does he have a plan for rebuilding?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Will this place still be a cafe when it's rebuilt?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: After a brief silence, the city hall official gives his answer.
No.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: The owner is gone. There's no one to inherit this shop. Your job is not to rebuild it.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Not rebuild? Then...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: You must tear it down.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Tear it down?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: All of it? The entire shop?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: The official nods.
I... I can't do that...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: There will be other workers. Plenty of manpower.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Your wages will be paid out of the city hall's Fashion Street rebuilding project.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: If you accept this job, I will draft an employment contract for you on behalf of city hall that will protect the rights that you are entitled to.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: No, that's not what I mean... I mean this shop.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: The furniture, the shelves... the previous owner really took care of them.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: It would be such a shame to tear it all down... all the sweet memories of Old Siesta.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Have you ever heard about the story of the wayfowl and homefowl?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Wayfowl... homefowl?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: The words sound familiar... what do they mean?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: When I was little, my grandfather told me stories of a kind of fowlbeast.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Legends say that an ancient kind of fowlbeast used to live on that beach.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Beach... you mean Old Siesta?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: But Old Siesta didn't exist when those fowlbeasts filled the skies and forests.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Perhaps not even Mount Siesta did.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: It was that long ago? Even the volcano didn't exist yet?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: What's the story with those fowlbeasts?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Once upon a time, they were not a single kind of fowlbeast.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: They were a complex community, comprising many different species of migratory fowlbeasts, 'wayfowls' that came from all over the land, and its members took many different forms and habits.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: At first, they gathered in the woods by the beach.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Sometimes they fought one another. Some left, while others stayed, building their nests and nursing the next generation together.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Eventually, they became one species that ate the same fruits and sang the same songs. They made their home here, and become 'homefowls'.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: My grandfather loved the story. He believed that these ancient fowlbeasts were like Siesta.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Can we still see these fowlbeasts today?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I'm afraid not... at the end of the story, a heavy rain that lasted many years caused the sea to rise and flood the woods where they made their home.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: That was the last that anyone knew of those fowlbeasts.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Ann-Maier?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I... I'm fine.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: It's just a legend.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: In reality, Siesta has been much more fortunate than those fowlbeasts.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I know...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I just remembered where I heard the words 'wayfowl' and 'homefowl'.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Grandpa, what's that word on this can of sour orange sauce?
attributes.name: Young Girl

attributes.content: It says 'Siesta'.
attributes.name: Kindly Old Man

attributes.content: Siesta? What's Siesta?
attributes.name: Young Girl

attributes.content: Oh my, have you forgotten already, Ann-Maier?
attributes.name: Kindly Old Man

attributes.content: Siesta is an orange that's not yet ripe.
attributes.name: Kindly Old Man

attributes.content: Siesta made wayfowls settle down and become homefowls. Siesta is the home that we built.
attributes.name: Kindly Old Man

attributes.content: Wayfowl... homefowl? I don't understand.
attributes.name: Young Girl

attributes.content: Someday you will, little one. Someday.
attributes.name: Kindly Old Man

attributes.content: So your grandfather once told a similar story...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Sorry, Mr. Costa... I keep thinking back to the past.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I know the feeling.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I often think back to the times that I spent with my grandfather.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: But the memories that don't fade also don't impede my ability to look forward.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: She hears the sound of music and casts her gaze in the direction of the sound.
The scarlet door of the instrument shop is wide open, and dim lights fall upon packaging boxes big and small.
The owners sit with the workers on the ground, holding various instruments in their hands from guitars to tambourines to maracas, to folk instruments the names of which she does not know.
A dissonant note causes everyone to stop.
Hey, who played it wrong this time?
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Oh, maybe it was me...
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: But this is how it goes back at my hometown...
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Let's all adjust, then.
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Some changed the chord, some slowed down the rhythm. The worker does not change his notes, but the phrase is once again in harmony.
One more time. Three, two, one—
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: It's the calluses on our hands, the brick dust on our shoulders♪
attributes.name: Everyone

attributes.content: The wine of our meeting, the song of our parting♪
attributes.name: Everyone

attributes.content: This is Siesta, this is home♪
attributes.name: Everyone

attributes.content: This is Siesta...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Yes, this is Siesta.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Hello?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Yes, this is Ann-Maier...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: You say you got me an interview with a construction company by way of apology?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Oh, I'm afraid I'll have to decline.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: No, I was at fault for what happened today, too. Thank you very much. Hope to talk to you again.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: From city hall?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Uh-huh.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Why did you turn it down?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Maybe because I understand what wayfowl and homefowl mean now... well, maybe not all of it...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: But like you said, I have time to learn about the city... I should slow down and take it all in.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: That's why I'll take this job.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: She looks at the dusty shop.
I'll clear out the old furniture and repaint the walls within the apportioned time, restoring this house to its former glory.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: This is my first job in Siesta.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier
